title: Bjergsen showing in LCS why LB is ridiculous.
body:
In the TSM vs TiP game going on currently, Bjergsen shows us exactly why (not his crazy plays, as it was pretty straight forward) LeBlanc is kind of silly with her mobility at the very least.


Lee Sin was in the blue buff area, ward hops over the wall, LB follows him over. Lee Ult kicks her back over the blue pit, she just LB jumps BACK to him. Lee Flashes the wall to his own mid turret. LB follows, her jump comes off cooldown finally, she jumps, kills Lee under his own turret, then just jumps out safely.


Why should any champion have this much mobility? When you have zero safety anywhere on the map and can kick her over a wall to still be followed over TWO walls and killed under your turret...that is a bit silly. It wasn't even as if the LB was fed, cause at the time he only had 2 kills, so it wasn't a fed LB doing this, nor great mechanical plays. 

I don't get it.

Exactly this. And He didn't use flash (LB). It was all his jumps. Lee sin ulted him over a wall to get away, ward hopped over a wall, and flashed over a second wall....still killed under a turret.

Seriously, how is that okay? And this is coming from someone who really doesn't like Lee Sin, but when Lee Sin can't get away ward hopping, using his ult, and burning flash, but dies under a turret, then something is wrong.

Breaking down that play:

Leblanc had to use both summoners (he flashed to get in range for the last W) to get the kill. Lee sin also didnt use his mobility to get away - he used his ward hop on a pink ward he was standing less than 200 units from, which actually placed him closer to LB instead of further away. 

also take in mind that most professional Lee Sins run 21-9-0. Rush didnt buy a cinderhulk - his only defensive stats came from a sightstone. He was also level 7 while LB was 10. 

if an assasin cant kill someone who isnt tanky and 3 levels behind with both of her summoners, im not sure what you expect from this game.

EDIT - and 2 kills with +40 cs is pretty fed in a professional game. whenever you see solo kills in a professional game, the 'killing' team almost always wins.

Sure, Lee has okay damage and decent dueling, but to be out-damaged and out-mobiled by Leblanc... I mean, if it was an adc I'd understand, but *the* mobile melee champion?

Ouch.

I could understand this type of mobility a little better if she couldn't also 100-0 me in 1 second.

One or the other but both is a little silly.
